title: ‘No one who has received this vaccine should panic or worry,’ Murphy says of J&J COVID shot
body: While New Jersey has  after federal authorities announced Tuesday concerns about rare blood clots, Gov.  urged the more than 235,000 people in the state who have already received that vaccine not to be overly concerned.  “No one who has received this vaccine should panic or worry,” Murphy said during a public event in Paramus. “A pause for further investigation is a precautionary and smart step.”The state’s Department of Health announced Tuesday it would  to suspend J&J vaccinations after  between the ages of 18 and 48 had  six to 13 days after vaccination.Murphy said there haven’t been any reports of similar adverse effects in New Jersey. It was unclear how many doses the state has in its stockpiles but has not yet administered. Last week, the state received 131,000 doses of the Johnson & Johnson vaccine, but it received only 15,600 this week, health officials said at  The allotment was expected to drop again next week.Murphy has counted on the Johnson & Johnson vaccines as being critical to hit his administration’s goal of vaccinating 70% of the state’s eligible population by the end of June. Murphy said Monday “J&J was explicit over the weekend that they would still be able to achieve their 100 million dose production by the end of June.”He said the state expected to get 1 million doses of the Johnson & Johnson vaccine by June 30.But Murphy said on Tuesday he still believes meeting the original 70% vaccination goal is “entirely achievable.”Note to readers: if you purchase something through one of our affiliate links we may earn a commission.
